channel.title: Spaces on Lelah's Blog
channel.description: Recent content in Spaces on Lelah's Blog

item.title: Grandpas and Snails
item.author: lvanEijnsbergen@outlook.com (Lelah van Eijnsbergen)
item.description:
I do this things in the morning sometimes where I walk around my neighborhood park and act like I’m a curious and eager kid in a very old and slow body. I look, feel, smell, etc. It grounds me, gets me in a curious and at the same time slows me down. It’s wonderful.

Today the park gifted me a whole bunch of snails. Some making a long track over the stone path, others having climbed high in a berry bush eating the meal of a lifetime I imagine. (Un)fortunately I didn’t have my phone to take a picture, so you’ll have to trust me that they were really really cute. I even got to see insides of one of the sail when I looked close enough.

item.title: Shared Spaces
item.author: lvanEijnsbergen@outlook.com (Lelah van Eijnsbergen)
item.description: During another algorithmically cultivated stroll around the internet I came across a yt video by Pagemelt that’s about algorithms and what they do to us as humans. And towards the end Pagemelt says something I feel like I profoundly relate to. It is that when i reach for something to scroll (yt, instagram, etc) that I do this most likely because I’m feeling lonely. Not the kind of lonely where i have no-one to talk to, but the one where I’d just love to be in a space with people around living their life, doing things, whatever that may be. I wonder what kind of spaces I have in my life that are like that, and if there are new shared spaces I can discover or create myself…
